definition: condition or type of pulse (in Chinese medicine)
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: This research is mainly based on the pulse condition identification.
sentences.chinese: 本文的研究主要是基於脈象識別展開的。

sentences.english: Objective:To explore relationship between the sphygmograms of the radial arteries and coronary heart disease(CHD).
sentences.chinese: 目的，爲了探討寸口脈脈象圖和冠心病的關係。

sentences.english: Objective To simulate the human pulse patterns expressively and objectively by using engineering technique.
sentences.chinese: 目的利用工程學方法形象客觀地模擬人體各種脈象。

sentences.english: I just used my Kungfu to change my pulse only, no big deal.
sentences.chinese: 況且我只用內力改變了自己的脈象罷了。

sentences.english: She had no pulse, but death seemed absent still.
sentences.chinese: 死神似猶尚未降臨，可她卻摸不出脈象。

sentences.english: This usually means an excess of fire or Yang energies in the body.
sentences.chinese: 這種脈象通常意味着體內陽氣過盛，或者有火。

sentences.english: Thereby the condition of heart-qi and the blood volume may be shown in both the pulse condition and the complexion.
sentences.chinese: 因此，心氣的狀況和血液量可以從脈象和麪色中體現。

sentences.english: Wiry pulse was the common pulse tracings of hypertensive disease.
sentences.chinese: 弦脈是高血壓病的常見脈象。

sentences.english: Soit was necessary to develop a pulse condition simulator.
sentences.chinese: 因此研製中醫脈象模擬儀有其必要性。

definition: (TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
interpretation of the cause/onset and process of an illness/pathogenesis
surface of the body/periphery of the body/body thermometer/(literary) a person's appearance
what is true and what is false/(to get to know) the real situation
to stagnate/to congeal/(fig.) to stop still/to freeze
to treat the symptoms/reactive (rather than proactive)
slight or important, urgent or non-urgent (idiom); to deal with important matters first/sense of priority
